We had net cash inflow from the financing activities for fiscal 2025 and 2024 amounting to ₹1,828.50 lakhs and ₹87.75 lakhs respectively primarily on account of proceeds from long-term borrowing (net) of ₹ 2,099.99 lakhs and ₹ 279.13 lakhs respectively. For fiscal 2023, we had net cash outflow from the financing activities of ₹ 862.88 lakhs on account of repayment of long-term borrowing (net) of ₹ 269.52 lakhs and repayment of short-term borrowing (net) of ₹ 426.21 lakhs.
The above activities resulted in the net cash flow increase in cash and cash equivalents in fiscal 2025 and 2023 and net cash flow decreased in cash and cash equivalents in fiscal 2024.

Any negative cash flows in the future could adversely affect our business, results of operations and financial condition. For further details, see “Management's Discussion and Analysis of our Financial Condition and Results of Operations – Cash Flows” on page 235. Negative cash flows over extended periods or significant negative cash flows in the short term, could materially impact our ability to operate our business and implement our growth plans. We cannot assure you that our net cash flows will be positive in the future. In the event we witness negative cash flows in the future, our results of operations, cash flows and financial condition may be adversely affected.

**18. Our logo registration status is currently 'formalities check pass'. Failure to secure and protect our intellectual property, including our pending trademark registration for our logo, may expose us to infringement, imitation, legal disputes and potential loss of market share.**

Our Company has applied for registration of its logo as a trademark, which, as of the date of this Draft Red Herring Prospectus, is under the status of formalities check pass. Until such registration is granted, we do not enjoy statutory protection or exclusive rights over the use of this logo. In the absence of a registered trademark, third parties may adopt or register identical or deceptively similar marks, which may cause confusion among consumers, dilute our brand recognition and erode our goodwill. Further, if another entity secures registration for a similar logo before us, we may face restrictions on using our own mark, which could disrupt our branding and marketing efforts.

The lack of registered rights also limits our ability to enforce intellectual property protection through legal proceedings. Without a valid registration, pursuing infringement actions or seeking injunctions against unauthorized use becomes more challenging and may leave us vulnerable to exploitation by competitors or other entities seeking to benefit from our reputation.

In addition to risks associated with our pending trademark, there is also the risk of our Company inadvertently infringing third-party intellectual property rights. Such claims, if raised, may lead to legal disputes, injunctions, damages, or penalties and may cause disruption to our business activities. Legal proceedings relating to intellectual property may involve costs, time and diversion of management attention away from business operations.

Failure to obtain statutory protection for our trademark, or any claim of infringement brought against us, could have an effect on our brand identity, market positioning, revenues and results of operations. For further details, please refer to the section titled “Government and Other Approvals” on page 253.
**19. We may be subject to industrial unrest and increased employee costs, which may adversely affect our business and results of operations.**

As of March 31, 2025, our workforce comprised 131 permanent employees, including labor staff. Our employee benefits expense comprise payments made to all the personnel on our payroll and engaged in our operations.
The table below sets forth our employee benefits expense and such as a percentage of total revenue from operations for the period and fiscal years indicated:
